text: hello I'm Jeremy gerin I'm a Solutions
architect with Amazon web services and I
specialize in Microsoft workloads
running on ad and today I'm going to
talk to you about how to choose actor
directory Solutions running on
AWS so what are your options to run
actor directory on AWS the options to
run active directory Solutions on AWS
include AWS directory service for
Microsoft active directory otherwise
known as AWS manag Microsoft ad AWS
actor directory connector otherwise
known as ad connector AWS simple ad
self-managed ad running on Amazon
elastic compute Cloud otherwise known as
Amazon ec2 let's first dive into the
adus directory service offerings they
include AWS managed Microsoft ad AWS
managed Microsoft ad is based on Windows
Server 2019 and offers a full ad
experience it works with the existing
Microsoft management consoles as well as
the actor directory Powershell
commandlets provided by Microsoft
customers are given limited permissions
over the directory we provision an organ
ganizational unit or OU based on the
name of the net bios name of the domain
and customers are giving full control
over the objects within that OU we also
delegate a subset of permissions outside
the OU which can include DNS server
management group policy management as
well as deploying pki it comes in two
additions Enterprise and standard the
biggest difference between those two
additions is Enterprise supports up to
500,000 objects as well as the ability
to extend your existing actor directory
into multiple regions standard edition
supports up to 30,000 objects but does
not offer the ability to extend into
multiple regions the service itself is
available in 31 regions today that
includes the two govcloud regions it
offers broad AWS and thirdparty
compatibility most thirdparty
applications will work with the service
as long as they don't require domain
admin or Enterprise admin and it also
offers a on to many domain relationships
via trust next up we have the AWS 80
connector it is a non-caching
authentication proxy for AWS
applications it comes in two additions
small and a large the additions are
identical other than the compute behind
them I generally recommend to customers
to start with a small addition and if
they need to upgrade to a large they can
open a support case requesting an
upgrade it is also available in 31
regions and it's compatible databas
applications so it does not work with
third party applications and it offers
only a one toone domain relationship so
if you have a complex on premises actor
directory environment you may have to
have multiple ad connectors for each
domain in your active directory
environment next up we have AWS simple
ad it's a Linux Samba based actor
directory solution it offers a limited
ad experience cu the ACT directory
Powershell commandlets do not work with
it the Microsoft act directory
Management console does work with it but
it is limited in what it can and cannot
do compared to the full Microsoft actor
directory it comes available in two
additions a large and a small as as well
it's only available in six regions with
no plans to extend beyond those six
regions it has limited AWS and third
party compatibility since it is not a
true actor directory not every
application will work with it also
customers do not have the ability to
connect it to other domains it does not
support trust finally we have actor
directory on Amazon ec2 this offers a
lot of flexibility cuz you get to choose
the OS you get the complete ad
experience as a result you also have
full permissions you control everything
you can deploy any where you can deploy
a server so it's available in every ads
region as well as some additional
options like Outpost or snowballs it has
limited AWS application compatibility as
not every application can natively
integrate with actor directory without
the aid of an ad connector or AWS
managed Microsoft ad with a trust but it
does offer the broadest thirdparty
compatibility as you have full
permissions if it's ad compatible it
will work with the service it also
offers a OneMain domain relationship via
trust just like ad manag Microsoft ad so
how do you choose between these actor
directory Solutions on AWS well first up
is AWS manag Microsoft ad these are the
questions I ask customers when I talk to
them the very first one I ask is do you
need to use Amazon relational database
service otherwise known as RDS with
Windows authentication Cur Rose
authentication if the answer is yes Adas
manage Microsoft ad is required now you
notice I have an ASX next to that answer
the reason being is just recently we
launched Amazon RDS for SQL server
support for self-managed ad that is the
only Amazon RDS type that currently
supports self-managed ad so the other RS
types still require ads manage Microsoft
ad if you want to have Windows curos
authentication next up do you want a
managed actor directory solution if yes
ads managed Microsoft ad may be a fit
are not having domain Enterprise admin
acceptable for you if the answer is yes
ads manag Microsoft ad May may be a fit
are 500,000 or fewer objects in actor
directory acceptable if yes AWS manag ad
may be a fit finally do you plan on
migrating to AWS managed ad and also can
you accept that Sid history is not
available let me explain what Sid
history is real quick Sid history offers
customers the ability to reuse their
existing SIDS when they migrate from one
domain to another a sid is a unique
identifier each actor directory object
has it's Unique to that object and
cannot be reused anywhere else Sid
history allows the ReUse of existing
SIDS it is not enabled by default with
adus managed ad if the answer is yes to
both of those ads managed ad may be a
fit you may notice all these answers say
may be a fit there's a lot of nuance to
selecting a directory Services solution
and these are just general questions to
point you in a direction further
investigation is necessary to come to
the final solution next up we have aw8
connect Conor and let's see if that's a
fit do you require applications
supported by ad connector if yes it may
be a fit do you require identity solely
stored in a single actor directory if
yes ad connector may be a fit again as
stated previously may be a fit there's a
lot of nuance to selecting a solution
here next up we have actor directory on
ec2 and let's see if that's a fit do you
require access to Enterprise or demain
admin groups if the answer is yes
continue using self-managed ad do you
require Direct access to domain
controllers themselves if yes continue
with self-managed ad do you require your
directory to expand on premises that can
include other Cloud providers as well as
data centers around the world and
AWS if the answer is yes to that please
continue to use self-managed ad and do
you require agents or software to be
installed on the domain controllers
themselves uh these can include security
software uh logging software things like
that if the answer is yes contines using
self-managed
ad I want to thank you for your time
today to watch this video also in the
description below this video you'll see
